conbody.p: toolbarThe toolbar can be used for quick access to many frequently used functions of Dialog Nibelung. The toolbar panel is located along the left side of the main teacher module window ( ).
The toolbar panel can be customize individually for every teacher.
Select ViewCustomize toolbar from the main menu to set up the toolbar. A Customize toolbar window ( ) will appear on your screen.
Elements of the Customize toolbar window:

row.entry: Move item up the list button
Move item down the list button

conbody.p:
The following actions can be made accessible via the toolbar:
Conversation with the whole class (see section )
Mute microphone (see section )
Recording of the whole class (see section )
Message to the class (see section )
Thumbnails of the whole class (see section )
Autoscan the class (see section )
Lock input on all student workstations (see section )
Lock all student workstations (see section )
Launch applications (see section )
Terminate remote process (see section )
Disable internet access for the whole class (see section )
Disable removable media for the whole class (see section )
Raise student module windows (see section )
Logout (see section )
Power off student workstations (see section )
Reboot all student workstations (see section )
Put all student workstation into standby mode (see section )
Power on all student workstations (see section )
Switch teacher (see section )
Open teacher folder (see section )
New class (see section )
Open class file (see section )
Save class file (see section )
save class file as... (see section )
Registration roll call (see section )
Start a lesson (see section )
Homework assignments (see section )
Exit Dialog Nibelung.

Select an item from the list of Available actions on the left and press the Move action to selected button (3 in ) to move it to the list of actions that appear in the toolbar. You can rearrange the items in the selected actions list by using buttons 6 and 7 in . You can also insert a separator onto the list to organize toolbar actions into logical groups.
conbody.note: Don't forget to make the toolbar visible by selecting ViewToolbar from the menu.
